perturbation.original_text: Blue Hills Bancorp, Inc. (the "Holding Company"), a newly formed Maryland corporation, Hyde Park Bancorp, MHC, a Massachusetts­ chartered mutual holding company (the "MHC"), Hyde Park Bancorp, Inc., a Massachusetts corporation (the "Mid­Tier"), and Blue Hills Bank, a Massachusetts­chartered stock savings bank (the "Bank" and together with the Holding Company, the MHC and the Mid­Tier, the "Blue Hills Parties"), hereby confirm their agreement with Keefe, Bruyette & Woods, Inc. (the "Agent") as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: Blue Hills Bancorp, Inc. (the "Holding Company"), a newly formed Maryland corporation, Hyde Park Bancorp, MHC, a Massachusetts­ chartered mutual holding company (the "MHC"), Hyde Park Bancorp, Inc., a Massachusetts corporation (the "Mid­Tier"), and Blue Hills Bank, a Massachusetts­chartered stock savings bank (the "Bank" and together with the Holding Company, the MHC and the Mid­Tier, the "Blue Hills Organizations"), hereby confirm their agreement with Keefe, Bruyette & Woods, Inc. (the "Agent") as follows:
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines "Blue Hills Parties" as a collective term. This change replaces it with “Blue Hills Organizations”, but the contract continues to use “Blue Hills Parties” in later sections. This creates confusion as to whether obligations apply to all original parties or a different set of entities.

perturbation.original_text: Subject to the terms and conditions herein set forth, the Blue Hills Parties hereby appoint the Agent as their exclusive financial advisor and conversion agent (i) to utilize its best efforts to solicit subscriptions for Shares and to advise and assist the Holding Company and the Bank with respect to the sale of the Shares in the Offering and (ii) to participate in the Offering in the areas of market making and in syndicate formation or to act as sole book-running manager in the Underwritten Offering (if necessary).
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to the terms and conditions herein set forth, the Blue Hills Parties hereby appoint the Agent as their exclusive financial advisor and conversion agent (i) to utilize its best efforts to solicit subscriptions for Shares and to advise and assist the Holding Company and the Bank with respect to the sale of the Shares in the Offering and (ii) to participate in the Offering in the areas of market making and in syndicate formation or to act as sole book-running manager in the Underwritten Offering (if necessary). Subject to the terms and conditions herein set forth, the Blue Hills Organizations hereby expects the Agent as their exclusive financial advisor and conversion agent (i) to utilize its best efforts to solicit subscriptions for Shares and to advise and assist the Holding Company and the Bank with respect to the sale of the Shares in the Offering and (ii) to participate in the Offering in the areas of market making and in syndicate formation or to act as sole book-running manager in the Underwritten Offering (if necessary).
perturbation.explanation: This change duplicates the language, replacing “appoint” with “expects” and “Blue Hills Parties” with “Blue Hills Organizations”. Since this section outlines key responsibilities, using weaker language (“expects”) and a potentially different entity (given the first change) creates uncertainty about the Agent’s firm obligations. It is uncertain if the Agent must fulfill the responsibilities since the language is not definitive.

perturbation.original_text: Section 4. Representations and Warranties of the Blue Hills Parties. The Blue Hills Parties, jointly and severally, represent and warrant to and agree with the Agent as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: Section 4. Representations and Warranties of the Blue Hills Organizations. The Blue Hills Parties, jointly and severally, represent and warrant to and agree with the Agent as follows:
perturbation.explanation: This change titles the section as “Blue Hills Organizations”, but the content refers to “Blue Hills Parties”. Given the confusion introduced in previous perturbation, it’s unclear which entities are making the representations and warranties and thus who is liable if these warranties are breached.
